marketNews.title: ⛏️ INCO 2024: Net Profit -79% YoY, Below Expectations
marketNews.content:
Vale Indonesia ($INCO) recorded a net profit of 7 million US dollars in 4Q24 (-51.9% QoQ, -81.6% YoY). This result brings the net profit for 2024 to 58 million US dollars (-78.9% YoY), below expectations as it only met 87.7%/82.5% of Stockbit/consensus estimates. Although revenue in 4Q24 (+5.2% QoQ) managed to grow quarterly, net profit decreased primarily due to a rise in operating expenses (+111.4% QoQ) and other income reversing to a loss of 4 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24: profit of 12 million US dollars).

- Rise in Operating Expenses and Reversal of Other Income

The increase in operating expenses was driven by rises in all operating expense lines, which we estimate are related to the opening of new pits in Pomalaa and Bahodopi. Meanwhile, the reversal of other income was mainly caused by a reversal of profit from the recognition of the fair value of derivative assets (related to additional participation rights in the HPAL smelter project) turning into a loss of 10 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24: profit of 9 million US dollars).

- Potential Addition to Nickel Ore Production and Sales Volume

INCO recorded nickel matte production of 18,528 tons in 4Q24 (+2.9% QoQ), bringing the total nickel matte production volume for 2024 to 71,311 tons (+0.8% YoY) and slightly higher than the target level of 70,805 tons. INCO has the potential to record higher nickel ore production and sales volumes in the coming years, following the opening of new pits in Pomalaa and Bahodopi. Based on guidance from management, INCO potentially records an additional sale of 1.7 million wmt of saprolite in 2025, consisting of 1.4 million wmt from Bahodopi and 300,000 wmt from Pomalaa. Previously, INCO did not sell saprolite nickel ore and only sold nickel in matte form.

Key Takeaway

We see the prospect of INCO's performance recovery going forward being influenced by: 1) the trend of nickel prices amid an oversupply condition; 2) the company's efforts in efficiency; and 3) sales volume growth from the contribution of nickel ore from new pits in Pomalaa and Bahodopi.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Said Import Tariffs on Canada and Mexico Will Start Next Month
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, said that import tariffs against Canada and Mexico will begin next month, after being delayed for 30 days while negotiations are underway. Previously, the US planned to impose import tariffs of 25% for Canada and Mexico starting February 4, 2025. Trump also announced that retaliatory tariffs against countries hindering US trade will begin as early as April 2025. In the middle of this month, US Secretary of Commerce, Howard Lutnick, said that all studies related to retaliatory tariffs will be completed by April 1, 2025, allowing Trump to act immediately thereafter. In addition, Trump ordered his cabinet to investigate potential import tariffs for copper commodities.

marketNews.title: China Plans to Start Bank Capital Hike with at Least $55 Billion
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Chinese government plans to inject at least 400 billion yuan or 55 billion US dollars in capital into several tier-1 banks, including Agricultural Bank of China Ltd. and Bank of Communications Co. Bloomberg sources mentioned that this plan could be completed as early as the end of June 2025, although it may change and the capital amount for each bank is still in the finalization stage. This step is a follow-up to the stimulus package announced in 2024 to support the struggling economy.

marketNews.title: Wings Food Launches Packaged Drinking Water Product with Aquviva Brand
marketNews.content: Wings Food launched a packaged drinking water (AMDK) product under the Aquviva brand on Tuesday (25/2). Antara reported that the product will be released in 1,600 ml, 700 ml, and 250 ml polyethylene terephthalate (PET) bottles. In addition, Aquviva also plans to launch a gallon package in the future.

marketNews.title: ESDM Director Says Minister will Release Ministerial Decree on March 1, 2025 Mandating Coal Exports Use HBA
marketNews.content: Director at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Julian Ambassadur, said on Tuesday (25/2) that the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, will release a Ministerial Decree on March 1, 2025, mandating that coal exports use the Reference Coal Price (HBA).

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto Launches Gold Bank Service
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Wednesday (26/2) launched a bullion bank service that will provide gold storage services to help maintain domestic gold stock. President Prabowo claimed that the gold bank can help the state save foreign exchange by allowing the entire gold supply chain to remain domestic. Previously, the Financial Services Authority (OJK) approved the operating permits for gold banks for subsidiaries of Bank Rakyat Indonesia ($BBRI), PT Pegadaian, and Bank Syariah Indonesia ($BRIS), so both can now offer financing, trading, and gold storage services to customers. According to regulations, financial companies are required to have at least 14 trillion rupiah in capital if they want to become a gold bank.

marketNews.title: Pertamina Denies Mixing Pertalite into Pertamax
marketNews.content: VP Corporate Communication of PT Pertamina, Fadjar Santoso, claimed on Tuesday (25/2) that they ensure the product reaching the public complies with its specifications, following issues that the company blended Pertalite in the Pertamax product. Fadjar claimed that the specification checks of fuel oil from PT Pertamina have been periodically inspected by the National Oil and Gas Testing Center (Lemigas). The issue arose after the Head of the Attorney General's Legal Information Center, Harli Siregar, explained that a suspect in a corruption case within a subsidiary of PT Pertamina mixed RON 92 fuel oil (equivalent to Pertamax) with RON 90 (equivalent to Pertalite) at Pertamina's storage facility. According to Fadjar, this case is not about blending Pertalite into Pertamax, but rather related to the alleged purchase of RON 90 fuel oil which was then claimed as RON 92.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia to Provide IDR 130 Trillion for 3 Million Houses Per Year Program
marketNews.content: Advisor and younger brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Wednesday (26/2) that Bank Indonesia has agreed to provide 130 trillion rupiah to support the program of building 3 million houses per year. However, Hashim did not detail the scheme Bank Indonesia will use to provide this support. Previously, the Governor of Bank Indonesia, Perry Warjiyo, last week mentioned that Bank Indonesia would purchase bonds for the housing construction program through the secondary market, although he did not specify the amount.

marketNews.title: 3 Million House Per Year Project to Start in April 2025 with Qatari Investment
marketNews.content: Head of the Housing Task Force and younger brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated on Wednesday (26/2) that the project to build 3 million houses per year will start in April 2025, coinciding with the realization of investments of around 18-20 billion US dollars from Qatari investors, Qilaa International Group. Hashim claimed that the program is attracting interest from investors from several countries, including China, the United Arab Emirates, India, and Turkey.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Decided Not to Change PLN's Monopoly in Domestic Electricity Market
marketNews.content: Advisor and younger brother of President Prabowo Subianto, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, said on Wednesday (26/2) that President Prabowo has decided not to change the monopoly of the State Electricity Company (PLN) in the domestic electricity market. Previously, President Prabowo during the election campaign had considered ending PLN's monopoly so that new and renewable energy producers could sell directly to customers. Hashim's statement comes amidst proposals from several House of Representatives members to include a power wheeling scheme in the draft law on new and renewable energy, which allows new and renewable energy producers to channel electricity to the PLN grid and sell it directly to customers. However, Hashim claimed that if power wheeling is implemented, it could turn the domestic electricity sector into a 'Wild West' and would be dominated by non-Indonesian people.

marketNews.title: Industry Minister: Apple Inc. Should Soon be Able to Sell iPhone 16 Series in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, said on Wednesday (26/2) that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) will soon be able to sell the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia following the achievement of several agreements with the government, including the construction of a manufacturing plant and a research and development center. Agus did not specify the value of the investment Apple will provide in this agreement, while Bloomberg reported that the Cupertino, US-based company will invest 1 billion US dollars, which includes the construction of an AirTag factory. Apple will soon obtain the Domestic Component Level (TKDN) certificate which is the sales permit, but Agus did not explain when this certificate will be issued.

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia (INCO) 4Q24 Net Profit Down 51.9% QoQ to $7 Million, Driven by Higher Operating Costs
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia ($INCO) recorded a net profit of 7 million US dollars in 4Q24 (-51.9% QoQ, -81.6% YoY). This result brings the net profit for 2024 to 58 million US dollars (-78.9% YoY), below expectations as it only met 87.7%/82.5% of Stockbit/consensus estimates. INCO recorded nickel matte production of 18,528 tons in 4Q24 (+2.9% QoQ), bringing the total nickel matte production volume for 2024 to 71,311 tons (+0.8% YoY) and slightly higher than the target level of 70,805 tons. INCO has the potential to record higher nickel ore production and sales volumes in the coming years. The reversal of other income was mainly caused by a reversal of profit from the recognition of the fair value of derivative assets (related to additional participation rights in the HPAL smelter project) turning into a loss of 10 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24: profit of 12 million US dollars).

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu Buys 1.5 Million BREN Shares in IDR 9.4 Billion Transaction
tickerNews.content: The controller of Barito Renewables Energy, Prajogo Pangestu, purchased 1.5 million BREN shares at an average price of 6,272 rupiah per share on February 25, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 9.4 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu's ownership in BREN increased from 0.09783% to 0.09896%.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) 2024 Komatsu Sales Hit 4,420 Units, Hitting 101.6% of Target; Coal Production Reached 148 Million Tons
tickerNews.content: United Tractors ($UNTR) recorded sales of Komatsu brand heavy equipment totaling 253 units in December 2024 (-37% MoM, +21% YoY). Cumulatively throughout 2024, Komatsu sales reached 4,420 units (-16% YoY), equivalent to 101.6% of the 2024 target of 4,350 units, with a market share of 26% (vs. 11M24: 27%, 2023: 29%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 148 million tons (+15% YoY) during 2024, with overburden removal of 1.22 billion bcm (+5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Adikarsa Sarana Increases Stake in EMTK to 14.09% via IDR 900 Billion Stock Transaction
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Elang Mahkota Teknologi, PT Adikarsa Sarana, purchased approximately 2.3 billion EMTK shares at an average price of 400 rupiah per share on February 24, 2025, which is -37.5% lower than the EMTK stock price at the closing of the exchange on the same day at 640 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached 900 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Adikarsa Sarana's ownership in EMTK increased from 10.43% to 14.09%. This is part of the EMTK stock transaction in the negotiated market previously reported in Stockbit Snips on Monday (24/2).

tickerNews.title: Avia Avian (AVIA) 2024 Net Profit Reaches IDR 1.7 Trillion, Meeting 103% of Consensus Estimate
tickerNews.content: Avia Avian recorded a net profit of 504 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (+0.41% YoY, +43% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 1.7 trillion rupiah (+1.35% YoY), equivalent to 103% of the consensus estimate. Sales successfully grew to 2.1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (+12% YoY, +16% QoQ), resulting in total sales for 2024 of 7.5 trillion rupiah (+6.5% YoY). Meanwhile, the gross profit margin was recorded at 45.3% in 4Q24 (-340 bps YoY, +180 bps QoQ) and 44.7% during 2024 (-7 bps YoY). On the other hand, operational expenses in 4Q24 slowed down to 406 billion rupiah (-12% YoY, -3.5% QoQ), although they still rose +7.2% YoY during 2024.

tickerNews.title: Sejahtera Raya Perkasa Reduces IMAS Stake to 5.02% via IDR 11.3 Billion Reverse Repo Transaction
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Indomobil Sukses Internasional, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa, sold 23 million IMAS shares at an average price of 493 rupiah per share on February 18, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 11.3 billion rupiah, with the transaction purpose being for reverse repo. After this transaction, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa's ownership in IMAS decreased from 5.6% to 5.02%.

tickerNews.title: Uni-Charm Indonesia (UCID) 2024 Net Profit Decreases 19.5% YoY to IDR 350 Billion Amid Price War and Export Decline
tickerNews.content: Management of Uni-Charm Indonesia held a 4Q24 earnings call on Wednesday (26/2), where the company attributed the revenue decline during 2024 to: 1) a price war in the diaper segment following downtrading; and 2) a decline in exports because Uni-Charm India can now meet its own domestic demand. UCID recorded a net profit decline in 4Q24 to 117 billion rupiah (-26% YoY vs. 3Q24: net loss of 21 billion rupiah), bringing the net profit for 2024 to 350 billion rupiah (-19.5% YoY). The decline in net profit in 4Q24 was mainly due to stagnant revenue and a decrease in operating profit margin. Revenue in 4Q24 was flat year-on-year at 2.5 trillion rupiah (+19% QoQ), resulting in a 2024 revenue decline of -5.6% YoY to 9.6 trillion rupiah. Meanwhile, the operating profit margin dropped to 5.6% (vs. 4Q23: 8%) amid a rise in the gross profit margin to 22% (vs. 4Q23: 21%) due to a significant increase in operating expenses, mainly in sales promotions and employee costs.

tickerNews.title: Cikarang Listrindo (POWR) Announces Roadshow for Debt Issuance up to $500 Million in Singapore
tickerNews.content: Cikarang Listrindo ($POWR) announced it will conduct a roadshow from February 26 to March 4, 2025, in connection with the issuance of debt securities of up to 500 million US dollars on the Singapore stock exchange. POWR has also appointed Barclays Bank plc, BNI Securities Pte. Ltd., and Deutsche Bank AG as joint bookrunners. The EGM in November 2024 had approved the company's plan to undertake this corporate action, which is aimed at refinancing previous debt securities.

tickerNews.title: Robby Adijaya Increases WOWS Stake to 8.68% Through IDR 2.4 Billion Purchase
tickerNews.content: The shareholder of Ginting Jaya Energi, Robby Adijaya, purchased approximately 47.1 million WOWS shares at an average price of 50 rupiah per share between December 27, 2024, and January 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.4 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Robby Adijaya's ownership in WOWS increased from 6.78% to 8.68%.

tickerNews.title: Pandu Sjahrir Resigns as TOBA Vice President Director Following Appointment as Chief Investment Officer at Danantara Investment Management Body
tickerNews.content: Vice President Director of TBS Energi Utama, Pandu Sjahrir, submitted his resignation letter from his position in the company, following his appointment as Chief Investment Officer at the Danantara Investment Management Body. This plan will be discussed at the upcoming GMS, but the schedule has not yet been announced.
